data.text: @BBCSport Rules for one fuckin disgrace
@BBCSport Fuck the daft cunt iv never liked him anyway and his football `skills` are shit.
@MartinMuir8 @BBCSport https://t.co/UyM8hy8uFr
@BBCSport ... https://t.co/CgPgv5SPsZ
@BBCSport Maybe he can get rid of the one that’s come through my letterbox this morning.......nope, thought not, ✊💦
@BBCSport xxx well that's a surprise.
@RUSSHOLMES70 @BBCSport Hehehe it’s ok my lovely 😊 https://t.co/RmwqW9F1Kx

@BBCSport The man is a joke, tats and hairstyles, never a leader, how the hell did he get 50+ caps as England captain. Possibly the FA intervened to cash in on his marketing potential, he certainly didn’t deserve to lead the ‘golden generation! I blame Peter Taylor.
@BBCSport They ain't going to prosecute him are they he's a special human being.
@BBCSport Shoddy!

@BBCSport Shameful, to employ a bloke to get you off the hook when you were speeding! Almost 60mph in 40 mph zone - what would you do if one of your kids ran out in front of your Bentley? 'Sir' David Beckham - fuck off, no chance!!
@smudgewick @BBCSport Quite right, no one needs Mr Loophole. Just read the paper work carefully......perhaps Beckham cant read 🙄

@BBCSport There was no proof the letter turned up late.  The used the fact a letter from Bently to the Met Police turned up late with a first class stamp on it....So what?  Correlation is not causation. It's a bit of a joke.....
@jrwills007 @BBCSport If the paper work or due process of documents is incorrect then no one needs Mr Loophole.  No working man could afford him anyway
@BBCSport This is fucked up
@BBCSport He is a charlatan. He even wanted to know recently why he had not been awarded a knighthood. Wow. What arogance.
@BBCSport Money talks.
@GRedstorm @BBCSport Not withstanding how much this cost him to bring a lawyer in to fight his guilty admission case?  Where's the Justice???
@BBCSport TOSSER  ,  P off back America
@BBCSport It seems that most of us 'do the crime and pay the fine' but others 'do the crime and find a loophole.' It really doesn't alter the fact that you did it David! #ownup
@BBCSport going at that speed? The orrible tattooed chav should have the book thrown at him
@BBCSport Amazing the power you have when you are rich & famous. The fact is he was well over the speeding limit which he could have seriously injured someone.
@BBCSport Disgraceful - hope I see him face to face so I can tell the little shit how I feel about his action. Come on Karma where are you!
@BBCSport Fame can pay
@shazzerbang @southwestposh @BBCSport The main question is, do these people have a conscience . They know they did it procedural incompetence or not. They have no shame.
@BBCSport They would would punish you on a technicality so why not defend on one
@lufclynn @southwestposh @BBCSport No he probably wouldn’t have, he just got it by flashing his cash, when he could have found out for free, thick fecker 🤣🤣

@BBCSport I have huge admiration for DB, however on this point I think he should have accepted his punishment. He was doing 59 in a 40, not just slipping over by a few mph in a 30. Would people have been so quick to defend if he’d hit someone or something ? Don’t think so
@BBCSport https://t.co/4bSeuPdeIu
@BBCSport I wish I had tons of money when required.
@BBCSport through the would own up like a normal man would. No knighthood deserved now
@BBCSport A day late is a day late I would use it and expect the same result
@shazzerbang @BBCSport Thanks Sharon I’ll read it properly next time👍
@robman827 @BBCSport Couldn’t agree more

@shazzerbang @southwestposh @BBCSport However, I’m betting he wouldn’t have known the correct procedure before he hired an expensive lawyer to find it rather than accept the consequences of his actions
@BBCSport He got off from a fine. I bet he also didn’t get points, on his license. Makes you sick. Apart from the money and the “Brand Beckham”, how is he different from the rest of us?!
@BBCSport Don’t the soap boxers love jumping all over this ... 😂😂 get a grip.
@BBCSport Once again one rule for the privileged

@BBCSport Brill, why should super rich have to follow the same rules as us mere mortals, it's a great Victory for British justice, and sends a clear message to others that they can do what they like in the UK
@BBCSport Bollox
@BBCSport Because of his actions they will probably make it a month now to catch more minions
@BBCSport Theres a victory for the working man right there. I love equality in this country.
@BBCSport Beckham - take your pick - all meh.  Long may they remain in Californian exile.
@mrwarrenstein @BBCSport I don’t want him to accept prosecution but if he worked in a chippie or tesco he would have been prosecuted
@BBCSport The judge was a woman, and she saw becks and couldn’t prosecute him cos she fancies the fuck out of him
@BBCSport It's not only the third world that's corrupt.

@IanJohn2005 @BBCSport This is true, but, the authority that issued the fine will probably never issue a late one again, I’m annoyed because he probably won’t have learned from the near miss, if I thought he would now abide by the legal speed limit it wouldn’t be so bad would it.
@shazzerbang @BBCSport Serves him right for thinking he could get away with it

@debs810 @BBCSport The tax avoidance was due to him being advised incorrectly , he paid it back  when it was discovered,  it was wrong to try and avoid paying, he may never get a knighthood even though he works tirelessly for charity, even though he paid it back eventually.
@BBCSport Wanker

@RUSSHOLMES70 @BBCSport Nope, spot on, the offence 23rd Jan summons needs to arrive within 14 days it arrived on 7th Feb 15 days later, should have arrived by 6th at the latest, so a day late. 🤷🏽‍♀️🤦🏽‍♀️
@BBCSport Wanker , broke the law end of ! Fine was probably about 20 seconds of his earnings, wasting valuable court time .. Tosser
@BBCSport So annoying the the hard working, struggling Joe Public would get a fine but superstar multi millionaire gets off with it.

@southwestposh @BBCSport Not really, the correct procedure wasn’t followed by the issuing authority so whilst it bad he was doing that speed in the first place, the solicitor correctly appealed the fine, end of, if I knew the law or discovered the loophole I’d appeal too, however I don’t speed.
@BBCSport If it were me no doubt been fucked...aah well there you go

@paulreddish @BBCSport Exactly, no one is above the law, however, if the correct procedure isn’t followed  an you blame him for getting a win on appeal, and yes you’re right again on the point you made, he shouldn’t have been speeding, will it be a lesson for him, probably not 🤷🏽‍♀️
@jim_bainbridge @BBCSport Or knowing the law really well.

@McGeerafe @BBCSport if you ever get speeding fine or parking ticket check on internet because there are so many loopholes you can usually appeal & get fines/points quashed, I’ve successfully argued 8 parking tickets in the past 5 yrs, that said best thing to do is not speed/park illegally 😱🙃
@BBCSport So golden balls  avoids paying a speeding fine....he getting good at avoiding paying his way. First tax avoidance now a speeding find....youll never get your dong... shameful role model
@BBCSport Double standards

@BBCSport Beckham portrays himself as such a patriot yet when he breaks the law he can't face the consequences and has to pay his way out of his responsiblility. He has lost a lot of credibility over this. One rule for the rich another for the rest of us. #ShameOnYou
@BBCSport Is it me or are those dates wrong #5days
@BBCSport "And why is that?".  "Err, because it's David Beckham".
@BBCSport Fact is Beckham was speeding. Guilty. Statistically he raised the pedestrian fatality risk substantially. To him , not guilty on a technicality, is far more important.
@BBCSport ... rich privilege.
@BBCSport So there you have it, One Rule for normal citizens and a completely different rule for the rich, wow what an example to set for the younger generation. Absolute disgrace.

@BBCSport Blame the system. He got let off for a letter being delivered 1 day late which had to go via Bentley it seems. Why should that matter, time doesn’t change the crime! Obviously us lot get it sent direct to our house, not via Ford.
@BBCSport Ok, the letter was late, however he should have taken the pain of the fine, mere change in his pocket, as he was speeding. He's gone way down in my estimation.

@BBCSport He drove at 59 mph in a 40 zone, not exactly getting away with murder here.

Your average Joe can get away with much more than this

@BBCSport Whilst he can afford the ban and the fine, the process wasn't followed in issuing the ticket so he escaped prosecution, blame the process not the person, I'm also aware that he should not have been speeding etc etc
@BBCSport Bending it like beckham part to lads
@BBCSport https://t.co/ylvcVFPR0f

@BBCSport Having just been on Speed Course for driving 35mph in 30mph zone I am appalled - he MUST learn what are potential consequences of his speeding.  It is all about Impact Speed and explain in public why that matters. 
This allows others to speed too!
@BBCSport But the rest of us have to accept speeding tickets or charges eh... Ridiculous.

@BBCSport Hello Do you want to make you photo to realistic cartoon photo

@BBCSport That's wot money can do for you
@BBCSport Beckham should be ashamed of himself. He should have accepted prosecution. Great example to his kids. They have no chance with that parenting.
@BBCSport Bend the rules like Beckham.
@BBCSport Trust he’ll make a substantial payment to road death charities
@BBCSport Man of the people 😂
@BBCSport Prick
@BBCSport Not the first time he’s missed out on 3 points...
@BBCSport Of course. Fucking scumbags the lot of the
